verses.verse: In thee, O LORD<WH3068>, do I put my trust<WH2620>: let me never<WH408><WH5769> be put to confusion<WH954>.
Deliver<WH5337> me in thy righteousness<WH6666>, and cause me to escape<WH6403>: incline<WH5186> thine ear<WH241> unto me, and save<WH3467> me.

Be thou my strong<WH6697> habitation<WH4583>, whereunto I may continually<WH8548> resort<WH935>: thou hast given commandment<WH6680> to save<WH3467> me; for thou art my rock<WH5553> and my fortress<WH4686>.
Deliver<WH6403> me, O my God<WH430>, out of the hand<WH3027> of the wicked<WH7563>, out of the hand<WH3709> of the unrighteous<WH5765> and cruel man<WH2556>.
For thou art my hope<WH8615>, O Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>: thou art my trust<WH4009> from my youth<WH5271>.
By thee have I been holden up<WH5564> from the womb<WH990>: thou art he that took<WH1491> me out of my mother's<WH517> bowels<WH4578>: my praise<WH8416> shall be continually<WH8548> of thee.
I am as a wonder<WH4159> unto many<WH7227>; but thou art my strong<WH5797> refuge<WH4268>.
Let my mouth<WH6310> be filled<WH4390> with thy praise<WH8416> and with thy honour<WH8597> all the day<WH3117>.
Cast me not off<WH7993> in the time<WH6256> of old age<WH2209>; forsake<WH5800> me not when my strength<WH3581> faileth<WH3615>.
For mine enemies<WH341> speak<WH559> against me; and they that lay wait<WH8104> for my soul<WH5315> take counsel<WH3289> together<WH3162>,
Saying<WH559>, God<WH430> hath forsaken<WH5800> him: persecute<WH7291> and take<WH8610> him; for there is none to deliver<WH5337> him.
O God<WH430>, be not far<WH7368> from me: O my God<WH430>, make haste<WH2363><WH2439> for my help<WH5833>.

Let them be confounded<WH954> and consumed<WH3615> that are adversaries<WH7853> to my soul<WH5315>; let them be covered<WH5844> with reproach<WH2781> and dishonour<WH3639> that seek<WH1245> my hurt<WH7451>.
But I will hope<WH3176> continually<WH8548>, and will yet praise<WH8416> thee more<WH3254> and more<WH3254>.
My mouth<WH6310> shall shew forth<WH5608> thy righteousness<WH6666> and thy salvation<WH8668> all the day<WH3117>; for I know<WH3045> not the numbers<WH5615> thereof.
I will go in<WH935> the strength<WH1369> of the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>: I will make mention<WH2142> of thy righteousness<WH6666>, even of thine only.
O God<WH430>, thou hast taught<WH3925> me from my youth<WH5271>: and hitherto have I declared<WH5046> thy wondrous works<WH6381>.

Now also when<WH5704> I am old<WH2209> and grayheaded<WH7872>, O God<WH430>, forsake<WH5800> me not; until I have shewed<WH5046> thy strength<WH2220> unto this generation<WH1755>, and thy power<WH1369> to every one that is to come<WH935>.
Thy righteousness<WH6666> also, O God<WH430>, is very high<WH4791>, who hast done<WH6213> great things<WH1419>: O God<WH430>, who is like unto thee!

Thou, which hast shewed<WH7200> me great<WH7227> and sore<WH7451> troubles<WH6869>, shalt quicken<WH2421> me again<WH7725>, and shalt bring me up<WH5927> again<WH7725> from the depths<WH8415> of the earth<WH776>.
Thou shalt increase<WH7235> my greatness<WH1420>, and comfort<WH5162> me on every side<WH5437>.

I will also praise<WH3034> thee with the psaltery<WH3627><WH5035>, even thy truth<WH571>, O my God<WH430>: unto thee will I sing<WH2167> with the harp<WH3658>, O thou Holy One<WH6918> of Israel<WH3478>.
My lips<WH8193> shall greatly rejoice<WH7442> when I sing<WH2167> unto thee; and my soul<WH5315>, which thou hast redeemed<WH6299>.

My tongue<WH3956> also shall talk<WH1897> of thy righteousness<WH6666> all the day<WH3117> long: for they are confounded<WH954>, for they are brought unto shame<WH2659>, that seek<WH1245> my hurt<WH7451>.
